turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Thaumastocoris peregrinus.
turn.1: What does a male look like?
turn.2: The genitalia also comprise a U-shaped evenly setose paramere; setae becoming sparse apically.
turn.5: What does the reproductive tract look like?
turn.6: Female reproductive tract of "T. peregrinus" is generally similar to that of the thaumastocorid "Proxylastodoris kuscheli".
turn.8: However "P. kuscheli" has three meroistic telotrophic ovarioles per ovary, whereas "T. peregrinus" has only two meroistic telotrophic ovarioles per ovary.
turn.10: The ovaries are developed as large, ball-shaped reservoirs.
turn.11: Are there any other interesting aspects of this article?
turn.12: In Heteroptera, the number of ovarioles per ovary ranges from 2 to 17.
